body_html:
@chrisrsipes : To make sure I understand correctly, the htop screenshots you had attached earlier do not show the problem you're observing, right? (Because, in those I see the same 879MB of RSS and ~12GB of VIRT across all three screenshots).

If so, I'm still confused about the problem you're observing. For example:

  • How are you measuring "RAM usage"? As in, what number are you looking at?
  • Do you see the same issue with the example mentioned in #17930 (comment) ?
  • Can you provide a minimal example to reproduce the problem?

I'm still not quite sure I understand the problem, and can't reproduce it, so I'm having trouble being helpful :).

body:
@chrisrsipes : To make sure I understand correctly, the `htop` screenshots you had attached earlier do not show the problem you're observing, right? (Because, in those I see the same  879MB of RSS and ~12GB of VIRT across all three screenshots).

If so, I'm still confused about the problem you're observing. For example:
- How are you measuring "RAM usage"? As in, what number are you looking at?
- Do you see the same issue with the example mentioned in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/17930#issuecomment-375463817 ?
- Can you provide a minimal example to reproduce the problem?

I'm still not quite sure I understand the problem, and can't reproduce it, so I'm having trouble being helpful :).
